FuncDef:
The auto-defend action command enables the punishment function of attack source tracing and specify the punishment action.
The undo auto-defend action command disables the punishment function of attack source tracing. The auto-defend action command enables the punishment function of attack source tracing and specify the punishment action. The undo auto-defend action command disables the punishment function of attack source tracing. By default, the attack source punish function is low-priority.
CLIs: undo auto-defend action [ deny [ timeout <timeout-num> ] | error-down ]

ParaDef.Info:
Discards packets sent from an attack source.
-

Specifies the period during which packets sent from an identified attack source are discarded.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 86400. The default value is 300,in second.

Sets an interface that receives attack packets to the error-down state.
-

ExtraInfo:
The attack source tracing process consists of four phases: packet parsing, traffic analysis, attack source identification, and taking attack source punish actions. The auto-defend action command is applied to taking attack source punish actions. The device discards the packets sent from the identified source or Error-Down the interface receiving attack packets.
The device records the status of an interface as Error-Down when it detects that a fault occurs. The interface in Error-Down state cannot receive or send packets and the interface indicator is off.
